messages.title: Thurrock Labour was in your local area today

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fight Jackie Doyle-Price's disastrous Thames Crossing which will destroy our greenbelt
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Jackie Doyle-Price has sold Thurrock out. I will always oppose a second Thames crossing in Thurrock.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Stand up for the vital NHS services that residents rely on across Thurrock
keyPolicies.policyDescription: With Orsett hospital threatened with closure, Basildon hospital to be downgraded and 37 too few GPs it's time Thurrock’s NHS had a proper champion.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protect our children's education from the Tories £11 million cuts to Thurrock schools
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I am passionate about ensuring that our children receive the education they deserve and will always defend local schools.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Tackle the housing crisis by working to deliver affordable homes for Thurrock residents
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will build upon my record as leader of the local council to ensure that families living in Thurrock don’t see their children driven elsewhere by rising prices.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Deliver jobs and opportunities for local people
keyPolicies.policyDescription: My record as leader of the council shows I have the ability to be a strong local voice bringing investment and jobs into our area.

issues.education: Protect our children's education from the Tories £11 million cuts to Thurrock schools.

examples: Protect our children's education from the Tories £11 million cuts to Thurrock schools.
Jackie Doyle-Price has sold Thurrock out. I will always oppose a second Thames crossing in Thurrock.
With Orsett hospital threatened with closure, Basildon hospital to be downgraded and 37 too few GPs it's time Thurrock’s NHS had a proper champion.
I am passionate about ensuring that our children receive the education they deserve and will always defend local schools.
I will build upon my record as leader of the local council to ensure that families living in Thurrock don’t see their children driven elsewhere by rising prices.
My record as leader of the council shows I have the ability to be a strong local voice bringing investment and jobs into our area.
